    • Method Detail

      • getFileExtension

        public static java.lang.String getFileExtension(java.nio.file.Path fpath)
        Returns the extension of the image file name, excluding the dot.

        If the file name does not contain an extension, an empty string is returned.

        Parameters:
        fpath - the file path
        Returns:
        the file extension, for example: "jpg" or "png" etc, or an empty string if none

      • changeFileTimeProperties

        public static void changeFileTimeProperties(java.nio.file.Path fpath,
                                            java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime fileTime)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the last modified time, last accessed time, and creation time of an image file.
        Parameters:
        fpath - the file path to modify
        fileTime - the file time to set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while setting the file times

      • updateDateTakenMetadataJPG

        public static void updateDateTakenMetadataJPG(java.io.File sourceFile,
                                              java.io.File targetFile,
                                              java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime datetime)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a JPEG image file to a target location and updates its EXIF Date Taken metadata.

        This method updates the following EXIF fields in a lossless manner (without re-compressing the image data):

        • ExifTagConstants.EXIF_TAG_DATE_TIME_ORIGINAL
        • ExifTagConstants.EXIF_TAG_DATE_TIME_DIGITIZED

        The datetime parameter is converted internally to the EXIF date-time format yyyy:MM:dd HH:mm:ss, using the milliseconds since epoch provided by FileTime.

        Note: this is a temporary solution using Apache Commons Imaging libraries. There are plans to implement local libraries for direct metadata writing without external dependencies.

        Parameters:
        sourceFile - the original JPEG file to be copied
        targetFile - the destination file where the copy will be written
        datetime - the desired captured date-time to embed in the EXIF metadata
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the target file cannot be created or its parent directory does not exist
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during reading or writing the image

      • updateDateTakenTextualPNG

        public static void updateDateTakenTextualPNG(java.io.File sourceFile,
                                             java.io.File targetFile,
                                             java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime datetime)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a PNG image file to a target location and updates its Date Taken property within the PNG textual chunk.

        The method updates a textual chunk (named "Creation Time") using the specified date-time parameter, in the format yyyy:MM:dd HH:mm:ss. The image is written in a lossless manner without altering pixel data.

        Note: This is a temporary solution using Apache Commons Imaging libraries. Future plans include implementing local code for direct PNG metadata writing (updating textual chunks) without external dependencies.

        Parameters:
        sourceFile - the original PNG file to be copied
        targetFile - the destination file where the copy will be written
        datetime - the desired captured date-time to embed in the PNG textual chunk
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading, writing, or processing the image
